Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accommodating, home-like experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jordan N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved Rome. Our trip was made better and more relaxing by the welcoming couple running hotel sileo. Clean room. Quiet atmosphere. Right next to Termini station an walking distance to all sites in Rome. Would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bizarro
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to the train station (Termini) in Rome, and also near a laundromat, since after ten days of traveling, and prior to the transatlantic cruise back to the U.S., we were in need of both. Hotel Sileo is only about 2 blocks from the station, which was really convenient and the laundromat was only a block away. When we read the info about Hotel Sileo, it stated that they have a contract with the train company that provides daytime rooms for conductors on overnight trips, so we might have to vacate the room between 9a.m. and 7p.m. If that occurs, they hold your luggage for you. But we were there 3 nights and never had to give up the room during the daytime hours. We are two grandmothers who traveled together, and when I explained the situation to my friend, I told her we were renting the room by the hour... that evoked lots of laughter! The room was ample, clean and the bathroom - ditto. I think you will find this hotel a good choice for your stay in Rome, if you are looking for good value.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Convenient to train station, but don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: Blabbott
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night (60 Euros) because we had an early flight and wanted to be close to the train station. The room was small, dark and depressing. We didn't need to share a bathroom, but the bathroom was across the hall. Not sure of the hours kept by the staff. We had to ring a bell each time to get in and there was no one available 10pm-6am for check out.

Reviews.Title: “super nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian S
Reviews.Content: the hotel was just what we needed, perfect location, walking distance to everywhere (every major landmark), plus, most important, the owners are so very warm and friendly, BUT, you´ve got to try Italian language, just be kind and educated!!! if you want a genuine Italiane experience, go there!! Run by veru Italian owners, super kind, total sweethearts:)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for few nights”
Reviews.Author: StanimirB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect if you need to catch an early bus to the airport. The hotel is literally 5mins walk from Termini Station. It is easy to reach the main attractions by foot (of course if you are willing to walk all day). There are a few places to eat around the hotel but I wouldn't recommend either one... The couple that owns and runs the hotel are nice and cheerful all the time, but they hardly speak any English. It is good that I had installed GoogleTranslate on my phone - it is quite useful for a asking few questions ;). The easiest way to find the hotel is to look for the MarcoPolo signs. The hotel is on the 4th floor of an old building which host a couple other hotels. The restaurant downstairs is noisy, especially if you room overlooks the internal part of the building. Even though the hotel is rated as one star, it has all the amenities you would find in a 3* one: mini-fridge, safe, TV, AirCon, WiFi, hairdrier, double bed. The Bathroom was a little dodgy, but hey, at least it wasn't shared.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: gln126
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Rome Terminal. It is located on the 4th Floor. It is run by the same family on the 3rd Floor - Marco Polo Hotel. The owner is very friendly and helpful. The room is small but the bed is comfortable and the AC works well. They charge 1 euro for the small bottle of water in the room, but you can buy the water at the supermarket in the Rome Terminal for .50 euro for a liter bottle of water. If you don't mind drinking fountain water like the locals, there's plenty of cold water fountains in Rome. Just recycle your bottle and refill it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tasaar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sileo for 4 nights. It was better than we had expected based on Tripadvisor reviews. Our room had a mini fridge which was very useful since we could store food we had bought at the grocery store. They also had WiFi access in the main lobby. The service was really great, the owners spoke very little English but it all worked out. If we returned to Rome, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to train station, reasonable price hotel, good restos nearby”
Reviews.Author: GastownWanderer
Reviews.Content: We learned too late that it is generally not a good idea to get a hotel near the combined Termini train and bus station. But we did fine. We found it handy, in fact, to be so close to the key buses as we needed them often because the major sights of Rome are widely spread out (it's not a pedestrian city, that's for sure). And there were some decent restaurants with homemade-style food at a reasonable price (and others better not mentioned) near our hotel. The hotel was pretty basic. Cute lift to get there. Friendly owner, Alessandro, who speaks little English but somehow makes you feel very welcome — and teaches you repeatedly how to avoid getting pick-pocketed. While we were there, some repair or renovation was going on in another part of the building (the hotel takes up only one floor, and there are other hotels on other floors and other business tenants of various sorts) so it was a bit noisy at times — but we were out all day and there was no noise at night. Breakfast was the typically high-carb and no-protein kind found throughout Italian hotels. The two homemade-cooking style restaurants across from each other on the corner are worth repeat visits. Other than that, there's not much to see or do in the area and you need a bus to get just about anywhere else. We loved the Trastevere neighbourhood and if we're ever in Rome again would stay at a B&B or small inn there — but it would cost a lot more money than we spent at Hotel Sileo. When in Trastevere, make sure you check out La Botticella restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good position but poor beds”
Reviews.Author: guineverent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night because of its convenience to the train terminal. The room was basic, small bathroom but clean enough and the couple running the hotel were pleasant to deal with. The bed and pillow however were very uncomfortable the sheets were too coarse and scratchy. I woke with bites all over my arms, neck and face. Strangely my husband sleeping next to me wasn't bitten. This place was cheap enough but I would have paid more for a better standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyuta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated close to the main railway and bus station. I was satisfied with accomodation, the room are not luxury, but they are very cosy with nice italian furniture in it. The owners are very nice couple, which are willing to help and answer all your questions.When I come to Rome again, I will definitely stay at this place. Enjoy the Rome and Italian hospitality. Anna

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: wong_number
Reviews.Content: We were a group of three adults that stayed in a room at Hotel SileoThe couple that owned the hotel were extremely nice and the daughter was very helpful.As with other reviews we found the location to be good because it was close to the Termini station (bus and rail transport) and restaurants.The Termini had "brand name" stores at the station.at the bottom floor there was a grocery store which we frequented ,since their prices were fairly reasonable esp. for water.The negative points about the hotel was that the shower/bathtub were very dirty. I am not sure but it looked like fungus growing on the doors of the bathtub/shower.Our room faced the back of the restaurant and we could smell the grease when we had our windows open.Luckily it was in the autumn months that we were visiting. so we could keep the windows closed for most of the day.it was also quite noisy because the restaurant would be cleaning up at the end of the night and the garbage containers were in the back of the restaurant .We found that the dresser had food stains still on it from the previous guests.the room was shabby and the lighting was very dim. I think they were using low watt energy saving bulbs.It did appear that there were rooms that were better than ours so we asked if we could be moved but they said all the rooms were taken.We did try to find other hotels but it was quite hard to just "walk-in" and try to find a room since some hotels were already booked to capacity and others were leery as to why you did not have reservations.It is quite hard to find a hotel at the last minute so we just tried to make the best of a bad situation.We took Rick Steeves recommendation for Hotel Sileo but now I do not think he has even stayed at Hotel Sileo.I think his recent books are outdated and the recommendations are now hit and miss.So buyer beware

Reviews.Title: “Ideal little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chris66_10
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Sileo in September and has a very enjoyable stay. The owners were very friendly and helpful although they don't speak very much English, but why should they?. The room was clean and traditional with a small but perfectly adequate bathroom. If it's luxury and posh you are after then try the Hilton. The Sileo is a great budget hotel that is certainly worth a go. Right near to Termini station, the local area has lots of bars and restaurants to choose from (at reasonable prices) and of course the metro is in the station, although walking around Rome is very easy. I would recommend this hotel and Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for several nights”
Reviews.Author: Cymbaline_Ukraine
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband liked Sileo Hotel. It is situated in the old building and the interior is also made in the early twentieth century style. We stopped here two times during our trip to Italy - once for four nights when we wanted to see Rome and once for just one night for the early trip to the airport. When we first came here we got a room with the street Magenta view and spectacular pictures on the walls and even on the celing. One picture was with Romen Forum, another with Tiber (just as on the pictures of the previous reviewer), and the third - blue sky with clouds on the ceiling reminded Pantheon). The hall and the corridor is also beautifully decorated. At first the only problem was a smell of the oldness - I usually dislike it, however just in several minutes I cased to notice it. The owners were very friendly - they gave the map and brochure about Rome and forgave us drinks from the mini bar - the shampane,beer, water and juices while it was not staded on their site. It was a nice surprise. Bathroom equipment workd all the time, towels were new and soft, the soup, shamoo and the hairdrier was provided. I asked Maria, the owner's wife, if they could provide us this room when we come back on the way to the airport but she refused since this room was provided only to those who stay more than three nights. So when we came back, we got a much smaller room with the view to the not so picturesque yard, the dish washing sounds came from the restaurant and the overall decoration and furniture was worse than in that beautiful room. The bathroom also was much smaller. If I got this room during the first stay I would be dissapointed. However the convenience to the location to the both Rome airports transfers and the hall with the sculptures and lighted globe was still very attractive and the walls of the second room were also with pictures. I advise to stay in this hotel when you plan to stay more than three nights and choose another hotel if you plan to stay just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay- great value and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: daisylind
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay here, also known as Albergo Sileo. It's literally just around the corner from the main train station, which made it great for dropping off/ picking up our bags. The owners are very, very sweet- don't speak a lot of english, but enough to make do! We stayed in the single the first night (the one the train conductors stay in), and moved to a bigger private room the other two nights, due to availability. It's in the same building as the Fawlty Towers hostel- we were concerned about it being noisy (we were going to check that out, but heard it was a bit crazy!), but it wasn't a problem at all. Do remember- cash only! It's a fine place to stay, and it was a great place to base our Rome stay out of.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but make sure you check payment methods before arrival”
Reviews.Author: jarkkonieminen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in early May. The owners were lovely and made us feel right at home. The room was good and what we expected for this price in Rome. My one issue was that on check out the hotel indicated that they only accepted cash as payment which caused a major issue for myself. No where on either their website or at the front desk does it indicate that they don't accept credit cards!

Reviews.Title: “Italian Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: akchoc
Reviews.Content: I learned about the Hotel Sileo from Rick Steve's travel book about the special rate for short evening stays. We were catching the train in the morning and the Termini is not more than a block and a half away. We were delighted with the accomodations. Alessandro and his wife speak only Italian but smiles and hand motions go a long way. The "hotel" is on the fourth floor that can be reached by elevator or short flights of steps. The apartment is broken up into a nice lobby, the family's living quarters and a couple of rented rooms. There is a wash basin in the room with the toilet and shower down the hall. The rooms are very clean and homey. When we were ready to go out to dinner, Alessandro sent us to the resturant of his friend across the street where we enjoyed an exceptional meal, great wine and a very reasonable bill. While this street is not the prettiest you'll find in Rome, it felt safe and the location for ease of getting around could not be beat. If you are looking for a place to stay that makes you feel a part of Rome, this is for you. I would stay here for my entire time in Rome if I get the chance to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UNCBB113
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a triple room for five nights during the end of June 2007 as the first destination of a backpacking trip through Italy and France. The reason I am giving this hotel 5/5 is that it exceeded my expectations for a hotel in its price bracket and the ownership and staff were both exceedingly kind and accommodating. Our triple room was a very decent size considering the relatively small size of the average Roman hotel room when compared to its American counterparts. It was certainly clean, as was the bathroom. I am a rather big person (6'4, 230ish) and my broad shoulders made the shower feel a bit small, but that is a relatively minor issue in the grand scheme of things, and is about the only complaint I have about the hotel on the whole. The room was very quiet at night and attracts a quiet and respectful set of visitors. It is also a fairly good location for hotels in this price range. Most comparable hotels are a few block further from the train station and thus are a few long blocks further from the public transportation hub at Termini Train Station and are also a few blocks further from the historical center of Rome. Due its location, it is also is a safer neighborhood than many other hotel options that are further from the train station. The only negative that some might find annoying is that the hotel is located on the fourth floor. Their is an elevator, but some might be uncomfortable taking it if they are accustomed to large elevators, and this one is rather small. There is a very well priced internet center on the most direct route to the train station, which also makes this location even more convenient. All in all, this a very good budget option for those seeking centrally located accommodations in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected cancellation from their side”
Reviews.Author: kcsipke
Reviews.Content: In February we decided to go to Rome in October. In March I reserved 2 rooms in Hotel Sileo by email. They were kind in email, confirmed the reservation, and asked nothing like credit card number, etc. In the meantime I wrote to them once telling that our flying schedule changed, so arrival would be earlier. They wrote back immedaitely saying OK. Then 2 weeks before the trip I got a mail from them without greeting, only two lines in Italian. When I asked them to translate this to me, they wrote back: 'no breakfast, no bathroom inside, sorry'. I was disappointed and wrote back that we don't want to go there this way. I was lucky enough to manage to book room in another hotel. When I got home after our perfect trip in Rome I received an angry mail from Hotel Sileo, that they were waiting for us. I wrote back, that they there maybe should contact eachother and sent them the letters again in which they wrote the 'no breakfast, no bathroom' and my cancellation as well again. Since then no reply... Luckily they didn't recquire credit card number, otherwise I would be lacking some money I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Early Departure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sileo was an ideal overnight stay prior to an early morning departure from Rome Termini station. We booked a triple room, happy to leave our suitcases and pay a discount to occupy the room after 7pm. As it turned out we were offered a bigger room and had daytime access for the same price. When our host didn't have an electrical adapter suitable for my daughter's MP3 player, he went out and purchased one for her to use and then presented it to us to keep on our departure. Excellent and courteous service. On our two minute walk to the train in the morning i noticed that the buses to Ciampino airport were leaving from that end of Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “very fine hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: winewoman
Reviews.Content: The Sileo is a very fine hotel for the price, we were 3 girls with each our bed, which is nice after a long flight. The daughter speaks english very well, nice location, very quiet and as clean as can be for an old hotel. Breakfast is typical for Europe not very much of anything but very good caffe latte. The only complain would be not to go to the restaurant that they recommend which is the Stella Novena, the food was good but way overprice and paid 12 euro [18cad]for a bottle of house wine which usually goes for at least half of that.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sileo
HotelInfo.Address: Via Magenta, 39, 0185 Rome, Italy
